chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant John L Balzer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Disarming a Peace Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.21.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
-State is requesting Restitution Hearing. Hearing is scheduled for 9/20/2022 at 10:00am. (Still waiting on the restitution amount from Risk Management.) Court will allow the defendant to appear by zoom.
09/20/2022 COURT SETS RESTIUTTION TO $1,049.11

-Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

-Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

-Maintain Employment and/or combination of schooling. 
-No violent contact with : Any family member. 
-If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Letter from the Department of Corrections requesting the Court review the Judgment of Conviction
Letter from Atty Kees advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.
Exhibits #1 and #2 of the 09/20/2022 restitution hearing.
09/20/2022 Restitution Hearing

10:00 AM Defendant John L Balzer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anna M Kees in court for John L Balzer.  Attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

Case called for restitution hearing. 

Exhibit #1 marked for the State. 

State makes opening statements. Defendant makes opening statements. 

Exhibit #2 marked for the State. 

Waukesha County Risk Management Analyst Mark Jatczak is sworn-in and testifies for the State.
Exhibit #1 moved into evidence without objection. 
Cross-examination by the Defense. 
Exhibit # moved into evidence without objection. 
Defense has no witnesses. 
Court deems evidence closed. 

Closing arguments made by the State. Closing statements made by the Defense. 
10:57 am - Defendant was disconnected from video connection by the institution and no longer appears. 

For reasons stated on the record, the Court finds that restitution is appropriate, and will order restitution in the amount of $1049.11, and will order that an amended judgment of conviction be prepared.
Motion and Order to Seal Restitution Information, Signed by Judge Carter on 09/19/2022
Restitution Information
Motion and Order to Seal Restitution Information

Letter dated 08/19/2022, filed by the State, re: No objection to amending the Judgment of Conviction

Letter dated 08/12/2022, filed by Atty Kees, re: Judgment of Conviction

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 08/19/2022 - I will approve the request for 56 days credit.**
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Restitution hearing on September 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant John L Balzer in court, in custody, with attorney Anna M Kees.   
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to count 2.
Court finds the Defendant Guilty of count 2.
Counts 1 & 3 are dismissed as a read in.

FELONY WARNINGS PROVIDED:  REGARDING VOTING AND FIREARMS RESTRICTIONS.



Court orders the following:
COUNT:  2
Total Prison:  6 Years.
Initial Confinement:  3 Years.
Extended Supervision:  3 Years.
Concurrent to:  count 3 on 21CF1775

Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No VIOLENT contact with:  ANY FAMILY MEMBER.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.


RESTITUTION:  STATE IS REQUESTING THE MATTER BE SCHEDULED FOR A RESTITUTION HEARING (STILL WAITING ON THE RESTITUTION AMOUNT FROM RISK MANAGEMENT).
COURT WILL ALLOW THE DEFENDANT TO APPEAR BY ZOOM FOR THE RESTITUTION HEARING.

COSTS:  $268
DV SURCHARGE:  $100
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.


Defendant to be transferred to DCI - FORTHWITH.  Restitution hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Check Case scheduled for August 29, 2022.
Character letters filed by defense.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Anna Kees has been appointed to represent the defendant.
Review hearing on July 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on June 6th, 2022.
Proposed Competency Order

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key, unless in the event of an emergency and if they initiate contact.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

01:47 PM Defendant John L Balzer in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Attorney Steven Hughes appears as a friend of the Court as defendant is currently represented by the Public Defenders office on case 21CF1775. COURT ORDERS COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court will set this matter for a review hearing on the defendants next scheduled Court date of July 7, 2022 at 10:00 am before Judge Brad Schimel.  Review hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
